Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 武器屋「切磋琢磨」
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具屋「質実剛健」
Entry.EnglishText: Armor Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: ペトナジャンカ
Entry.EnglishText: Petnadjanka

Entry.JapaneseText: ペトナジャンカ・装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Petnadjanka - Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『商品の陳列棚』 「コチラ見本用、 商品はカウンターにて」 と書かれている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- A Display Case of Products - "Samples for Display only. Products are available at the counter." -is written on it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『お客様にお願い』 見本品での試し斬り、試し叩きなどお断り。 同行為をされた方は商品を相当額で お買い上げいただきます。 店主
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- A Request for All Customers - Please refrain from testing out the display products. Those who do so will be required to purchase the product at a reasonable price. -Storekeeper

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『宣伝用の看板』 ★満月の日はサービスデー！ 全品三割引きの超特価！ 武器屋「切磋琢磨」
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Signboard - ★Full Moon Sale! 30% off for all items! - Weapon Shop "Mutual Encouragement"

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマは本当に 仕事をよくさぼりやがるな。
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma really like slacking off, don't they?

Entry.JapaneseText: ここはオニの<Tytree>の口から うちのガジュマにびしっと 言ってやってくれないか？
Entry.EnglishText: How about you talk some proper sense into that Gajuma, <Tytree>?

Entry.JapaneseText: な、なんだよ、 この地鳴りは…… せ、世界の終わりか……？
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What the--!? Th-The earth's shaking... Is the world ending!?

Entry.JapaneseText: 攻撃は最大の防御なり！ 武器をそろえないでどうする！
Entry.EnglishText: Offense is the best defense! Equip to protect yourself!
Entry.Notes: janky. deepl says Offense is the best defense! What if we don't have the right weapons?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 武器を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Weapons Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: 気が向いたら、 また来いよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Feel free to come again when you change your mind.

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具屋には負けないぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: I ain't gonna lose to that guy over there!

Entry.JapaneseText: 街の中に誰もいないって？ まさか俺っちだけ仲間外れ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? There's no one in the city? Don't tell me... Did I get left behind...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……じゃないか。 防具屋のヤツもいる事だし、 まあ、いいか……
Entry.EnglishText: Or not... At any rate, the guy at the armor shop's still there. Whatever.

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか、俺っちのとこで 買った剣で<Tytree>を 殺したり……？
Entry.EnglishText: D-Don't tell me you're planning on killing <Tytree> with my swords!?

Entry.JapaneseText: そ、それだけは やめてくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: P-Please don't.

Entry.JapaneseText: よかった、<Tytree>…… なんか騒ぎに巻き込まれてるとは 聞いてたけど、無事で何よりだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, thank god... I heard something happened to you, but it looks like you're unharmed.

Entry.JapaneseText: で、セレーナが 大変だって聞いたけど…… どうしたんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that Selena's also in danger. What happened?

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたらが<Tytree>を 助けたんだって？
Entry.EnglishText: Were you the ones who saved <Tytree>?

Entry.JapaneseText: 同じ街の仲間を救ってくれた お礼はしたいが、ウチの商品を やるわけにはいかねえな。
Entry.EnglishText: I want to thank you for saving him, but I can't really part with my products.

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、気持ちだけ受け取ってくれ。 どうだい、この笑顔？
Entry.EnglishText: How about you accept my feelings, at least?

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナが戻ってきたって みんな喜んでるそうだな。
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that everyone' s happy with Selena's return.

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナって、 どこかに行ってたのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Did she go somewhere?

Entry.JapaneseText: 商売が忙しいもんで、 最近、世情にうとくてな。
Entry.EnglishText: Sorry, I've been so caught up with work that I'm a bit out of the loop.

Entry.JapaneseText: おお、<Tytree>の友達だな。 ま、安くはできんが、 見てってくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh you're <Tytree>'s pals, right? Well, I can't give you a discount but feel free to browse.

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具屋の奴、 何怒ってんだろうな？ なんか俺悪い事したか？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what the guy at the armor shop's pissed about? Did I do something wrong?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>、 聞いてみてくんないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, <Tytree>, get this...

Entry.JapaneseText: 隣の防具屋の野郎の 俺を見る目つきが なんかむかつくんだよな。
Entry.EnglishText: So that guy at the armor shop, the one over there? Well, the way he looks at me kind of pisses you off, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: 一体、どうしたって いうんだろうな？
Entry.EnglishText: Wonder what's gotten into him?

Entry.JapaneseText: なあ、近頃、 ガジュマたちの様子が おかしいと思わないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, don't you think the Gajuma have been acting a little strange, lately?

Entry.JapaneseText: この街はみんな 仲良くやってたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Like, everyone's all fine and dandy until those guys showed up.

Entry.JapaneseText: 後からやって来た ガジュマが悪いんだな、きっと。
Entry.EnglishText: I bet they're the ones behind this.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、街の中に ガジュマが増えたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The Gajuma in this city have been increasing lately.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんでもよその街を追い出されたんだと。そのせいか、俺たちヒューマを見る目が コワイんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Apparently they got kicked out of the city they're from... That explains the scared looks they give to Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺たちが悪い事をしたわけじゃ ないのにな……
Entry.EnglishText: Well, it's not like we did anything wrong...

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当にガジュマめ、 むかつくぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah... Those damn Gajuma really piss me off...

Entry.JapaneseText: このあいだなんか、隣の防具屋の野郎、 俺をこの店から追い出そうとしやがって……
Entry.EnglishText: That guy beside me, the one in the armor shop? Well, apparently he's trying to make me leave.

Entry.JapaneseText: こっちはこの場所で 先祖代々やってきたってんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: My family's been tending to this shop for generations! He'll have to kill me first before I leave here!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマ……あんたみたいな よそ者のガジュマが、 この街をおかしくしたんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: You Gajuma... Outsiders like you made this city go crazy!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたガジュマと 一緒にいるのはやめた方がいいぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'd advice you to stop traveling with that Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 連中、ひがみっぽいし、 なんにでもケチをつけやがる
Entry.EnglishText: They're always trying to find fault in you.

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当にどうしようもない 連中だぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: What a hopeless lot.

Entry.JapaneseText: どこかの田舎娘が 工場でのもめ事を解決してから、 工場も落ち着いたみたいだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Apparently, some country lass settled a fight over at the factory. It's calmed down since then...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも防具屋の野郎は 相変わらずなんだよな。
Entry.EnglishText: Unlike that bastard over there.

Entry.JapaneseText: よほど、俺に 不満とかあったのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: Maybe I really did do something wrong?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとおしゃべりなんぞ したくないね。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't want to talk to Gajuma like you.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか最近、俺おかしいよな。 ガジュマの事、急に嫌いに なったりして。
Entry.EnglishText: You know, something must've gotten into me... Like, I used to not hate Gajuma and then...

Entry.JapaneseText: いや……そもそも ガジュマが悪いんだよな……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Nah, never mind. It was their fault, anyway.

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺を追い出そうと するから……なぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, they're the ones trying to chase me out.

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具屋の奴がここんとこ 妙に静かなのが気になるな。
Entry.EnglishText: That guy at the armor shop's been quiet lately, it's creeping me out...

Entry.JapaneseText: 生きてるんだろうな？ <Tytree>、確かめてくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You still alive, <Tytree>? Lemme make sure...

Entry.JapaneseText: 旅の人にはわからないだろうけど 街が以前に比べると静かな気がするんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: You travelers prolly don't know, but Petnadjanka seems quieter than before.

Entry.JapaneseText: あのもめ事以来かな。 人と人の関係が少しだけ 変わった気がするよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I guess everyone's relationship has changed ever since that happened.

Entry.JapaneseText: 特にガジュマと ヒューマの関係がね。
Entry.EnglishText: Especially the ones between Gajuma and Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 隣の防具屋とは 創業時期が一緒でね。
Entry.EnglishText: You know, that armor shop next door was established at the same time as mine.

Entry.JapaneseText: 七代前のご先祖様からの よきライバルなのさ。
Entry.EnglishText: Way, way back. It's been this shop's rival for seven generations!

Entry.JapaneseText: ちゃ、ちゃんと 働いてますよ……!!
Entry.EnglishText: I-I'm properly working, Sir!

Entry.JapaneseText: あーあ、まったく やってらんねえな……
Entry.EnglishText: Ohhh... what a pain...

Entry.JapaneseText: あ……<Tytree>さん……!! な、なんでもありません……!!
Entry.EnglishText: S-Sir T-Tytree--!! Oh, uh...it's nothing!

Entry.JapaneseText: な、なんで こんなに地鳴りが……？
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-Why's the ground... shaking...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 攻撃の前に、まずは 自分の身を守れないと。
Entry.EnglishText: Consider your defense before going on offense.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 防具を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Armor Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: また来てくださいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back again!

Entry.JapaneseText: 武器屋には負けないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I ain't gonna lose to that guy over there!

Entry.JapaneseText: え？ 街の中に誰もいない？ さあ、どうしたんだろう……
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? There's no one in the city? I wonder what happened...?

Entry.JapaneseText: オイラだけ仲間外れ……？
Entry.EnglishText: D-Did they forget to tell me...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……なんか…… 気になってきたな……
Entry.EnglishText: Now I'm bothered about it...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>が工場の中で 大変な事になってるって？
Entry.EnglishText: What did you say!? <Tytree>'s in danger at the factory!?

Entry.JapaneseText: えっと……こんな時、オイラは…… ……どうすればいいんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Uhh... So... What am I supposed to do...?

Entry.JapaneseText: がんばれよ、<Tytree>。 落ち込みそうだったら、 オイラの顔を思い出してくれよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Good luck out there, <Tytree>. And whenever you feel down, please remember my face.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだよ、なんだよ、 そのイヤそうな顔は……？
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What's with that expression...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 君たちなら、きっとセレーナさんを 取り戻してくれる。 なんでか、そんな気がするな。
Entry.EnglishText: As long as it's you guys, Selena will definitely come home safe. I believe in you.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、旅には防具は欠かせないよ。 どんな強い人でもね。
Entry.EnglishText: But, first of all, you've got to get yourself some good armor, no matter how strong you guys are.

Entry.JapaneseText: そう、人には必ず愛が必要なように、 旅人にはまた防具が必要なのさ！
Entry.EnglishText: Just as how love is necessary for mankind, so is armor for travelers!

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナさんが助かったみたいだけど、 <Tytree>は、 まだ旅を続けるのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like Selena's back, but are you still gonna keep traveling, <Tytree>?

Entry.JapaneseText: だったらうちで防具を そろえていってくれよな。
Entry.EnglishText: Then you gotta get yourself some armor!

Entry.JapaneseText: さすが、キミたちなら 必ずセレーナさんを 助けてくれるって思ってた。
Entry.EnglishText: I always knew you guys would manage to get Selena back!

Entry.JapaneseText: オイラの勘は、隣の武器屋で 売ってる剣の刃よりも 鋭いからね。
Entry.EnglishText: My instincts are sharper than the swords sold at that weapons shop.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、妙にヒューマに 腹が立つ事はないかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Have you ever felt strangely annoyed towards Huma?

Entry.JapaneseText: オイラは毎日さ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've been having that feeling every day, lately.

Entry.JapaneseText: 隣の武器屋の顔を見るたびに ムカムカしてさ。
Entry.EnglishText: Like, I start to feel really pissed at the guy beside me for some reason.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>……か…… 悪いけど……買い物したら、 帰ってくれないか……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, hi <Tytree>... Sorry, but... could you not visit my shop anymore...?

Entry.JapaneseText: いや……すまない……
Entry.EnglishText: Ah-- No... Sorry...

Entry.JapaneseText: 無駄話するなら、帰んなよ。 ここは防具屋だ！
Entry.EnglishText: Look, if you're just here to chat then LEAVE! This is an armor shop, people!

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてヒューマなんて いるのかね……
Entry.EnglishText: Why do Huma even exist...?

Entry.JapaneseText: もういい加減、 ヒューマの隣で店やってるなんて 耐えられなくなってきたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Goddammit, I've had enough! I don't want to run a shop next to that damn Huma, anymore!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマには荷物まとめて、 さっさと出ていってほしい くらいだね。
Entry.EnglishText: Honestly, I wish that guy would just pack his bags and leave.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>だっておんなじさ！
Entry.EnglishText: That goes for you too, <Tytree>!

Entry.JapaneseText: 品物を買わないんなら、 さっさと帰れ！
Entry.EnglishText: Just leave if you're not gonna buy something!

Entry.JapaneseText: 工場の連中、ヒューマの娘に そそのかされてさ。
Entry.EnglishText: That Huma girl seduced all the guys at the factory!

Entry.JapaneseText: みんな、ヒューマの娘に そそのかされてるんじゃ ないのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if she seduced everyone else in town, too.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマはとりあえず、 この街から出ていけ！
Entry.EnglishText: At any rate, these Huma need to get out of here fast!
Entry.Notes: deepl says: Huma get out of this city for now!

Entry.JapaneseText: よくよく考えてみたら、 何もひとつの建物をふたつの店で 使う事ないよね。
Entry.EnglishText: I've been thinking... Isn't this building too small for two stores?

Entry.JapaneseText: よし……ヒューマの武器屋なんて 追い出してやるぞ……！
Entry.EnglishText: Alright, then! I gotta chase that Huma at the weapon shop first!
Entry.Notes: deep l says: Okay, I'm going to kick you out of ...... Huma's arms store. ......

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマはとりあえず、 この街から出ていけ！
Entry.EnglishText: At any rate, these Huma need to get out of here fast!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマが いがみ合いすぎて、ラジルダは 水の中に沈んだって聞いたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that Gajuma and Huma fought so hard that Razilda sunk underwater.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは気にくわないけど…… ちょっとおとなしくしとこう……
Entry.EnglishText: I... don't really like Huma, but... I guess I'll stay quiet for now.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは……！ いや……なんでもない……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma are...! Never mind...

Entry.JapaneseText: ペトナジャンカで 防具屋といえば、うちだけ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm your guy when it comes to weapons in Petnadjanka!

Entry.JapaneseText: ここで買わずして、 どこで買う？
Entry.EnglishText: If you don't buy your stuff here, then where else would you go?
